title: Vegan Pad Thai
shortDescription: Indulge in the flavors of Thailand with this vegan version of the classic Pad Thai. A delicious and satisfying noodle dish!
fullDescription: Indulge in the flavors of Thailand with this vegan version of the classic Pad Thai. Made with rice noodles, tofu, and a tangy sauce, it's a delicious and satisfying dish that can be customized with your favorite veggies. Top it off with crushed peanuts and fresh cilantro for an authentic touch.

instructionGroups.label: For the Pad Thai
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cubed tofu. Cook until tofu is golden brown and crispy.
Add julienned carrot, sliced red bell pepper, and sliced green onions. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Add cooked rice noodles and bean sprouts to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Pour the Pad Thai sauce over the noodle mixture. Stir-fry for a couple of minutes until everything is coated in the sauce.
Remove from heat and garnish with crushed peanuts and fresh cilantro.

instructionGroups.label: For the Pad Thai Sauce
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, lime juice, sriracha sauce (if using), and water until well combined.

tips: Feel free to add other vegetables like mushrooms or broccoli to customize your Pad Thai.
You can adjust the sweetness, tanginess, or spiciness of the sauce to suit your taste.
Garnish with lime wedges for an extra burst of citrus flavor.
